title: Stunning drone footage of eerie abandoned UK psychiatric hospital where 1,500 patients were caged and lobotomised
text:
Stunning drone footage of eerie abandoned UK psychiatric hospital where 1,500 patients were caged and lobotomised Now all that's left of the Denbigh Asylum is graffiti-strewn walls, rickety staircases and collapsed roofs. Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Inside the haunting remains of abandoned British mental asylum Share this video Get daily   
This stunning drone footage reveals the mangled remains of an abandoned UK asylum that once housed 1,500 patients. 
Patients were forced lobotomies at Denbigh Asylum in north Wales for nearly 150 years, since it opened in 1848 and until it closed in 1995. 
Now all that's left of the hospital is graffiti-strewn walls, rickety staircases and collapsed roofs. 
Filmmaking student Lee Rielly shot the incredible clip on a DJI Phantom 4 drone and wants to show people "true urban explorers see the history" of places of beauty and interest. More than 1,500 were caged at Denbigh Asylum in north Wales (Photo: mediadrumworld.com) Read More Haunting photos capture decaying Amazonian-themed water park days before it is demolished 
The 21-year-old, from Cockermouth, Cumbria, said: "I try to capture the history and emotion of each place that I go to. I like to show the decay of a building which was once filled with life and how it has just been forgotten. 
"I had heard many good things about this beautiful building and how I needed to see it before it comes crumbling to the ground." 
The student's incredible footage captures a breathtaking bird's eye view of Denbigh. Photos taken inside the building show debris crumbled on the floor and destroyed ceilings.
